data.name: MAIN_NET_WRONG_BIT
data.value:
It seems you installed 32-bit .NET instead of the 64-bit one, SysDVR-CLient will not work.

You can download the 64-bit version from: https://aka.ms/dotnet/6.0/windowsdesktop-runtime-win-x64.exe

Do you want to open it now ?

data.name: MAIN_DRIVER_NOT_FOUND_WARNING
data.value: Without installing the driver USB streaming may not work

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_INFOTEXT
data.value:
This page allows you to install the USB driver. Since version 5.5 SysDVR uses the standard Android driver provided by Google.
If you click install this setup will download latest driver provided by Google from the official link and prompt to install it This operation requires an internet connection

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_NOT_DETECTED
data.value: It seems Windows has never detected the SysDVR device ID, enable USB mode in SysDVR-Settings and connect your console. Note that USB-C to C cables may not work.

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_ERRORMESSAGE
data.value:
Restart this application and try again, if it keeps on happening open an issue on GitHub.
You can also try following the manual driver installation guide on GitHub

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_NOT_INSTALLED
data.value: It seems the driver is not installed, you need to install it to use SysDVR.

data.name: MAIN_GRP_STREAMINGSOURCE_INFO
data.value: Remember to switch to the correct mode with SysDVR-Settings on your console before beginning to stream. If you need help check the guide.

data.name: MAIN_NET_NOT_FOUND
data.value: .NET doesn't seem to be installed on this pc but it's needed for SysDVR-Client, do you want to open the download page ?\r\n\r\nYou need to download .NET 6 desktop x64 runtime or a more recent version

data.name: MAIN_INFOTEXT
data.value: This utility will configure the SysDVR-Client command line automatically. If you're not sure what to do here check out the guide on GitHub

data.name: MAIN_NET_OLD
data.value: It seems you're running an outdated version of .NET. SysDVR-Client requires .NET 6 runtime or a more recent version. Do you want to open the download page ?

data.name: MAIN_STREAMING_USB_INFO
data.value: USB (Will automatically install driver, if needed)

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_INSTALLED_ALREADY
data.value: The correct driver seems to be already installed, you don't need to install it again.

data.name: MAIN_DLL_NOT_FOUND
data.value: not found, did you extract all the files in the same folder ?

data.name: MAIN_NET_WARNING
data.value: If you don't upgrade the installed version SysDVR may not work.

data.name: MAIN_DRIVER_NOT_FOUND
data.value: You selected USB streaming but it seems that the SysDVR driver is not installed, do you want to install it now ?

data.name: DRIVERINSTALL_FORM_INSTALLED_ALREADY_INFO
data.value: It seems the driver is already installed, unless you face issues, you DON'T need to install it again.

data.name: MAIN_DRIVER_WARNING
data.value:
You selected USB streaming but Windows reports that it has never seen the SysDVR USB device, before continuing try the following: 1) Open SysDVR settings on your console and select USB mode then click apply. - If the settings app says SysDVR is not running, reboot your console. 2) Launch a compatible game. 3) Connect the console to the PC.
If you did everything correctly windows should play the device plugged in sound and possibly show a 'installing device' screen, if that happens click YES on this message box. if you don't see anything it is possible that your USB C cable does not support data connections and you should try a different one. USB C to C cables are known to cause issues.
Do you want to try searching for the SysDVR USB device again ? Pressing no will try to start streaming regardless but it will probably fail.

data.name: FILESTREAM_CONTROL_INFO
data.value: This will save the stream to an mp4 file. Minimal processing is done to the stream: the output file may be big or in a format that is not supported by some players, it's recommended to re-encode it with ffmpeg or another converter once the recording is done.

data.name: MAIN_STREAMOPTIONS_PLAY
data.value: Play with the built-in video player (Recommended)

data.name: MAIN_STREAMOPTIONS_PLAY_MVP
data.value: Play in mpv with low latency (single channel only)

data.name: MAIN_STREAMOPTIONS_PLAY_RTSP
data.value: Relay to a different video player via RTSP -- This is not the RTSP option in SysDVR-settings, read the guide if unsure

data.name: MPVSTREAM_DOWNLOAD
data.value: Download mpv from the official site

data.name: MPVSTREAM_INFO
data.value: To stream via mpv you must provide the path of its main executable (called mpv.com for windows)

data.name: PLAYSTREAM_SCALING
data.value: Use anisotropic filtering for scaling (direct3d renderer only)

data.name: PLAYSTREAM_USEACC
data.value: Use hardware acceleration for decoding (not recommended as auto detection may fail, it's better to use the --decoder option from cmd)

data.name: RTSPSTREAM_INFO
data.value: To connect to the RTSP stream open a video player (mpv is recommended) and connect to rtsp://127.0.0.1:6666/ (this is the fixed address of your pc, you don't need to change it)

data.name: RTSPSTREAM_LAUNCHINFO
data.value: Launch the stream automatically ? Select Mpv's main executable (Optional)
